dcterms:description: Survey data used to examine systematic differences in attitudes towards key social issues depending on exposure to the Rush Limbaugh Show.
dcterms:title: Congressional Election Study (CES)

dcterms:description: Panel data used to construct measures of political polarization from survey responses.
dcterms:title: American National Election Studies (ANES)

dcterms:description: Data on U.S. presidential elections used to calculate the Republican vote share for each presidential election for each county.
dcterms:title: Atlas of U.S. Presidential Elections

dcterms:description: Data on AM contours used to identify the spatial distribution of AM radio stations broadcasting the Rush Limbaugh Show.
dcterms:title: Data on AM contours from the Federal Communications Commission (FCC)

dcterms:description: Data on FM contours used to identify the spatial distribution of FM radio stations competing with AM stations broadcasting the Rush Limbaugh Show.
dcterms:title: Data on FM contours from the Federal Communications Commission (FCC)

dcterms:description: Nighttime lights data used as a proxy for population to analyze the effects of radio exposure.
dcterms:title: Nighttime lights data
